to put plants or seeds in the ground to grow

sentences.english: efforts to bring peace to the region
sentences.chinese: 给这个地区带来和平的努力

detailed_translations.english: a large area of a country or of the world, usually without exact limits

sentences.english: You should be able to evaluate your own work.
sentences.chinese: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。

sentences.english: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们要评估一下这次运动是否成功。

sentences.english: It can be difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatments.

detailed_translations.english: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is

sentences.english: Her hair was thick, glossy and in tiptop condition.
sentences.chinese: 她头发浓密、有光泽且发质一流。

detailed_translations.english: You can use tiptop to indicate that something is extremely good

sentences.english: 英文例句:To be totally secure, you need a piece of hardware that costs about $200.
sentences.chinese: 为保证绝对安全，你需要一个花费约为两百美元的硬件。

sentences.english: ...a shop from which an uncle had sold hardware and timber.
sentences.chinese: …一家叔叔曾经在那里卖五金器具和木材的店铺。

detailed_translations.english: computer machinery and equipment, as opposed to the programs that make computers work

sentences.english: He left the room, returning after a short interval with a message.
sentences.chinese: 他离开房间，过了一会儿就带回来一条消息。

sentences.english: We can get some drinks in the interval.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以在幕间休息时喝点什么。

sentences.english: Trees had been planted at regular intervals.
sentences.chinese: 树已按均距栽种。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time between two events, activities etc

name: development
trans: 发展；开发；发育；住宅小区（专指由同一开发商开发的）；[摄] 显影

sentences.english: child development
sentences.chinese: 儿童发育

sentences.english: The funds will be used for marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 这笔资金将用于市场营销和产品开发。

detailed_translations.english: the process of gradually becoming bigger, better, stronger, or more advanced

sentences.english: If the company was to relocate, most employees would move.
sentences.chinese: 如果公司要迁移，大多数员工得搬家。

detailed_translations.english: if a person or business relocates, or if they are relocated, they move to a different place

sentences.english: The dispute is going to arbitration (=  someone is being asked to arbitrate  ) .
sentences.chinese: 这场争议将提请仲裁。

sentences.english: Both sides in the dispute have agreed to binding arbitration .
sentences.chinese: 纠纷双方都接受了约束性仲裁。

detailed_translations.english: the process of judging officially how an argument should be settled

sentences.english: ...the difficulties facing women in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: …妇女在工作场所中面临的困难。

detailed_translations.english: the room, building etc where you work

name: aside
trans: 旁白；私语，悄悄话；离题的话

sentences.english: He pushed his half-eaten salad aside and left.
sentences.chinese: 他推开吃了一半的色拉走了。

sentences.english: He stepped aside to let Katherine go in first.
sentences.chinese: 他站到一边让凯瑟琳先进去。

sentences.english: Mark drew me aside and explained the problem.
sentences.chinese: 马克把我拉到一边给我解释这个问题。

sentences.english: She swept her thick hair aside.
sentences.chinese: 她把浓密的头发梳到一边。

detailed_translations.english: moved to one side or away from you

name: thrill
trans: 使…颤动；使…紧张；使…感到兴奋或激动

sentences.english: Winning first place must have been quite a thrill.
sentences.chinese: 赢得第一名肯定让人非常激动。

sentences.english: Even though I’ve been acting for years, I still get a thrill out of going on stage.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我演了多年戏，走上舞台我仍然感到十分激动。

sentences.english: It gave Pat a thrill to finally see the group perform live.
sentences.chinese: 帕特终于看到这个乐队现场表演，感到十分激动。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong feeling of excitement and pleasure, or the thing that makes you feel this

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…颤动；使…紧张；使…感到兴奋或激动
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel excited and happy

sentences.english: Charlie thinks money will solve all his problems.
sentences.chinese: 查理认为钱能解决他所有的问题。

sentences.english: the best way of solving our dilemma
sentences.chinese: 解决我们两难处境的最佳办法

sentences.english: attempts to solve a mathematical equation
sentences.chinese: 解数学方程式的尝试

detailed_translations.english: to find or provide a way of dealing with a problem

name: streamline
trans: 把…做成流线型；使现代化；组织；使合理化；使简单化

sentences.english: efforts to streamline the production process
sentences.chinese: 简化生产过程的努力

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…做成流线型；使现代化；组织；使合理化；使简单化
detailed_translations.english: to make something such as a business, organization etc work more simply and effectively

sentences.english: a period of adjustment
sentences.chinese: 一段调整期

detailed_translations.english: a small change made to a machine, system, or calculation

sentences.english: calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
sentences.chinese: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩回， 退出； 撤退

to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

sentences.english: Deposit any random checks you get - like rebate, rewards or reimbursement checks - into this fund.
sentences.chinese: 把你挣的随机钱——比如像回扣，鉴赏，或偿款等——存到这个基金里。

sentences.english: I placed an order for desktop pc memory which came with a $20 MIR [mail in rebate].
sentences.chinese: 我订购了一个价值20美元的桌面个人电脑存储器，可以申请回扣的。

sentences.english: We have no interest in interfering in the internal affairs of other countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们对干涉其他国家内政不感兴趣。

sentences.english: the threat to internal security
sentences.chinese: 对国内安全的威胁

sentences.english: internal markets
sentences.chinese: 国内市场

sentences.english: There’s to be an internal inquiry into the whole affair.
sentences.chinese: 对整个事件将进行内部调查。

detailed_translations.english: within a particular country

sentences.chinese: 房子位于林木茂密的小山坡上，环境十分优美。

detailed_translations.english: the type of area where a building is situated - used especially by people who sell or advertise buildings

sentences.chinese: 在前半部，工人们认识到他们的老板是在剥削他们，开始了解剩余价值理论。

sentences.chinese: 我希望随着时间的推移，人们将认识到公开谈论艾滋病是一件重要的事情，因为这是唯一一条使它成为像癌症一样的正常疾病的途径。

name: entitle
trans: 称做…；定名为…；给…称号；使…有权利

sentences.english: They understood that our power alone cannot protect us, nor does it entitle us to do as we please.
sentences.chinese: 他们懂得单凭实力无法保护我们的安全，实力也并不赋予我们随心所欲的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the official right to do or have something

sentences.english: These skills were passed on to subsequent generations.
sentences.chinese: 这些技能代代相传。

trans: 理想的；完美的；想象的；不切实际的

trans: 模糊的；含糊的；不明确的；暧昧的

sentences.chinese: 州长只是含糊地大致说了一下他的税务计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不明确的； 含糊的； 暧昧的
detailed_translations.english: unclear because someone does not give enough detailed information or does not say exactly what they mean

trans: 结婚；婚姻生活；密切结合，合并

sentences.chinese: 她前一次婚姻生了三个女儿。

sentences.chinese: 婚礼是在圣巴托罗缪教堂举行的。

detailed_translations.english: the relationship between two people who are married, or the state of being married

sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

sentences.chinese: 玛丽•雪莱创作《科学怪人》这部恐怖小说名作的时候年仅18岁。

sentences.chinese: 乔疲惫暴躁，而且情绪低落。

sentences.chinese: 火车正在运送过去由卡车运送的大批货物。

name: item
trans: 条款，项目；一则；一件商品（或物品）

sentences.chinese: 他打开纸板箱把里面的物品一一拿出来。

sentences.chinese: 这家商店正在减价出售家具和家居用品。

sentences.english: The original 1965 bottle is now a collector’s item (= one of a set of objects people like to collect because they are interesting or valuable ).
sentences.chinese: 这瓶1965年生产的原装酒现在是收藏品。

trans: 账户；解释；账目，账单；理由；描述

sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out

sentences.chinese: 罢工期间囤积食品的家庭

detailed_translations.english: to collect and save large amounts of food, money etc, especially when it is not necessary to do so

sentences.english: The sales figures won't be released until sometime next month.
sentences.chinese: 销售数据要到下个月的某个时候才会公布。

sentences.english: Sir Richard Marsh, the sometime chairman of British Rail
sentences.chinese: 理查德•马什爵士，英国铁路公司前董事长

detailed_translations.english: at a time in the future or in the past, although you do not know exactly when
former

sentences.english: She hired a detective to find out if her husband was having an affair.
sentences.chinese: 她雇了一个私人侦探调查她丈夫是否有外遇。

detailed_translations.english: a police officer whose job is to discover information about crimes and catch criminals

name: dismiss
trans: 解散；解雇；开除；让离开；不予理会、不予考虑

sentences.english: He just laughed and dismissed my proposal as unrealistic.
sentences.chinese: 他只是笑了笑，认为我的建议不切实际，拒绝考虑。

sentences.english: Bryant was unfairly dismissed from his post.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩特被无理免职了。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to consider someone’s idea, opinion etc, because you think it is not serious, true, or important

name: produce
trans: 生产；引起；创作；生育，繁殖

sentences.english: New drugs are producing remarkable results.
sentences.chinese: 新药正在产生显著的效果。

sentences.english: a rise in sea level produced by climatic change
sentences.chinese: 由气候变化引起的海平面升高

sentences.english: As a policy, it did not produce the desired effect.
sentences.chinese: 作为一项政策，它并未产生预期的效果。

sentences.english: a factory that produces microchips
sentences.chinese: 微芯片制造厂

sentences.english: He produced a letter from his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他从口袋里掏出一封信来。

detailed_translations.english: to cause a particular result or effect

name: realize
trans: 实现；认识到；了解；将某物卖得，把(证券等)变成现钱；变卖

sentences.chinese: 我们过了一段时间才意识到这场悲剧有多严重。

sentences.english: It was only later that I realized my mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我到后来才认识到自己的错误。

sentences.english: She never realized her ambition of winning an Olympic gold medal.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句:她一直未能实现赢取奥运会金牌的抱负。

detailed_translations.english: to know and understand something, or suddenly begin to understand it

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

sentences.english: We all know that most wine in restaurants is over-priced: a markup of 200 percent on cost is considered normal.
sentences.chinese: 我们都知道饭店中大部分葡萄酒标价过高：在成本价上涨200％被认为是正常的。

detailed_translations.english: A markup is an increase in the price of something, for example the difference between its cost and the price that it is sold for

sentences.english: Each individual leaf on the tree is different.
sentences.chinese: 树上每片叶子都不相同。

sentences.english: the needs of the individual customer
sentences.chinese: 每位顾客的需求

detailed_translations.english: considered separately from other people or things in the same group
a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in

name: last
trans: 末尾，最后；上个；鞋楦（做鞋的模型）
最后的；最近的，最新的；仅剩的；最不可能…的
最后地；上次，最近；最后一点

sentences.english: I didn’t read the last chapter of the book.
sentences.chinese: 我没有看这本书的最后一章。

sentences.english: Add the flour last.
sentences.chinese: 最后加面粉。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing at the end, with no others after
after everything or everyone else

sentences.english: I sometimes have to work late.
sentences.chinese: 我有时得工作到很晚。

sentences.english: Sometimes, Grandma would tell us stories about her childhood in Italy.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，祖母会跟我们讲讲她儿时在意大利的经历。

sentences.english: ‘Do you ever wish you were back in Japan?’ ‘Sometimes. Not very often.’
sentences.chinese: “你有没有想过希望回到日本？”“有时候吧，但不经常这么想。”

sentences.english: The journey takes an hour, sometimes even longer.
sentences.chinese: 路上需要一小时，有时甚至更长。

detailed_translations.english: on some occasions but not always

name: recognition
trans: 识别；承认，认出；重视；赞誉；公认

sentences.english: He stared at her, but there was no sign of recognition .
sentences.chinese: 他盯着她看，但似乎没认出她来。

detailed_translations.english: the act of knowing someone or something because you have known or learned about them in the past

name: unsatisfactory
trans: 不令人满意的；不满足的；不符合要求的

sentences.english: an unsatisfactory situation
sentences.chinese: 让人不满意的状况

detailed_translations.chinese: 不令人满意的；不满足的；不符合要求的
detailed_translations.english: not good enough or not acceptable

name: carpet
trans: 在…上铺地毯，把地毯铺在…上；斥责

sentences.english: The building has been carpeted throughout.
sentences.chinese: 大楼里上上下下都铺了地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…上铺地毯，把地毯铺在…上；斥责
detailed_translations.english: to cover a floor with carpet
heavy woven material for covering floors or stairs, or a piece of this material

sentences.english: I’ve known Barbara for years. Since we were babies, actually.
sentences.chinese: 我认识芭芭拉很多年了，实际上我们从小就认识。

sentences.english: Actually, on second thoughts, I don’t think I want to go out tonight.
sentences.chinese: 其实再想想，我今晚不打算出去了。

detailed_translations.english: used to add new information to what you have just said, to give your opinion, or to start a new conversation

name: accountability
trans: 有义务；有责任；可说明性

sentences.english: View your job, and her job, as a shared accountability.
sentences.chinese: 把你和她的工作看做是一种联合责任。

sentences.english: But you must balance that need with the need for accountability.
sentences.chinese: 但是你必须在个人需求和责任感两方面做出平衡。

sentences.english: Some of us have trouble with accountability because we associate the word with punishment, scrutiny, and/or not meeting standards or agreements.
sentences.chinese: 好些人都把责任理解错误了，因为我们总是把责任和惩罚，仔细检查或者没有达到标准或不一致性联系在一起。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["electoral fraud"]}
sentences.chinese: 选举欺诈

sentences.english: She was found guilty of fraud.
sentences.chinese: 她被判犯有诈骗罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺诈， 诈骗； 骗子
detailed_translations.english: the crime of deceiving people in order to gain something such as money or goods

name: checklist
trans: 清单；检查表；备忘录；目录册

sentences.english: The guide contains a useful checklist of points to look for when buying a car.
sentences.chinese: 手册里有一张很有用的清单，列出买车时要注意的一些事项。

detailed_translations.chinese: 清单；检查表；备忘录；目录册
detailed_translations.english: a list that helps you by reminding you of the things you need to do or get for a particular job or activity

name: regularly
trans: 定期地；有规律地；整齐地；匀称地

sentences.english: We meet regularly, once a month.
sentences.chinese: 我们定期见面，每月一次。

detailed_translations.english: at the same time each day, week, month etc

sentences.english: ...the ladies' lavatory.
sentences.chinese: …女厕所。

detailed_translations.english: a toilet or the room a toilet is in

name: trail
trans: 小径；痕迹；尾部；踪迹；一串，一系列

sentences.english: The trail led over Boulder Pass before descending to a lake.
sentences.chinese: 小路越过博尔德山口，然后向下通往湖边。

sentences.english: The bus left a trail of black smoke behind it.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车开过，留下一股黑烟。

sentences.english: Police trailed the gang for several days.
sentences.chinese: 警察跟踪了那个团伙好几天。

detailed_translations.english: a rough path across countryside or through a forest
to follow someone by looking for signs that they have gone in a particular direction

name: value
trans: 值；价值；价格；重要性；确切涵义

sentences.english: The alterations doubled the value of the house.
sentences.chinese: 经改建后这所房子增值了一倍。

sentences.english: We decided to get the house valued.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定给房子估一估价。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that something is worth
to decide how much money something is worth, by comparing it with similar things

name: credit
trans: 信用，信誉；[金融] 贷款；学分；信任；声望
相信，信任；把…归给，归功于；赞颂

sentences.english: We found his statement hard to credit.
sentences.chinese: 我们觉得他的说法令人难以信服。

sentences.english: The witness’s story gained credit with the jury.
sentences.chinese: 证人的陈述被陪审团采信了。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true
the belief that something is true or correct

sentences.english: A small group of journalists waited on the pavement outside her house.
sentences.chinese: 有一小群记者守候在她家外面的人行道上。

sentences.english: a pavement cafe
sentences.chinese: 路边咖啡馆

detailed_translations.english: a hard level surface or path at the side of a road for people to walk on

sentences.english: The study found that some alcoholics had clear personality traits showing up early in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究发现一些酗酒者早在孩童时就表现出明显的个性特征。

detailed_translations.english: a particular quality in someone’s character

sentences.english: The timescale for completing the work would be fairly tight.
sentences.chinese: 完成这项工作的时间很紧。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time it takes for something to happen or be completed

sentences.english: 10,000 deaths a year from chronic lung disease are attributable to smoking.
sentences.chinese: 每年1万个慢性肺病患者的死亡可能是由于吸烟导致的。

detailed_translations.english: likely to have been caused by something

name: glance
trans: 扫视，匆匆一看；反光；瞥闪，瞥见

sentences.english: Wyatt glanced around the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 怀亚特环视了一下餐馆。

sentences.english: Emily glanced over her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 埃米莉回头看了一眼。

sentences.english: He gave her a quick glance and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速地瞥了她一眼，笑了。

detailed_translations.english: to quickly look at someone or something
a quick look

name: flat
trans: 平的；单调的；不景气的；干脆的；平坦的；扁平的；浅的
（尤指贴着另一表面）平直地；断然地；水平地；直接地，完全地
使变平；[音乐]使（音调）下降，尤指降半音
逐渐变平；[音乐]以降调唱（或奏）

sentences.english: The bed can be folded flat for storage.
sentences.chinese: 这张床可以折扁存放。

sentences.english: He lay flat on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他平躺在地板上。

sentences.english: That night I lay flat on my back and stared up at the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 那一夜，我仰面平躺，眼睛直直地盯着天花板。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平直地； 直截了当地
detailed_translations.english: in a position in which the surface of something is against another surface without curving or sloping

detailed_translations.chinese: 平的；固定的；漏气的；单调的，沉闷的；浅的
detailed_translations.english: smooth and level, without raised or hollow areas, and not sloping or curving
a place for people to live that consists of a set of rooms that are part of a larger building

sentences.english: The airline hopes to improve punctuality next year.
sentences.chinese: 这家航空公司希望明年在准点上做出改善。

detailed_translations.english: Punctuality is the quality of being punctual

sentences.english: The report was sharply critical of the police.
sentences.chinese: 报道猛烈地抨击了警方。

detailed_translations.english: in a critical, rough or severe way

name: liquid
trans: 液体的；清澈的；明亮的；易变的

sentences.english: Add a little more liquid to the sauce.
sentences.chinese: 在酱汁中再加一点水。

sentences.english: Children take antibiotics in liquid form.
sentences.chinese: 儿童服用液态抗生素。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is not a solid or a gas, for example water or milk
in the form of a liquid instead of a gas or solid

name: reshuffle
trans: 重新洗牌；改组；重作安排

sentences.english: The prime minister told reporters this morning that he plans to reshuffle his entire cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 首相今晨告诉记者们他计划改组全体内阁。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新洗牌；改组；重作安排
detailed_translations.english: When a political leader reshuffles the ministers in a government, he or she changes their jobs so that some of the ministers change their responsibilities
when the jobs of people who work in an organization are changed around, especially in a government

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

name: plethora
trans: 过多；过剩；[医] 多血症

sentences.english: a plethora of suggestions
sentences.chinese: 一大堆建议

detailed_translations.chinese: 过多；过剩；[医] 多血症
detailed_translations.english: a very large number of something, usually more than you need

name: late
trans: 晚的；迟的；已故的；最近的

sentences.english: Sorry I’m late – I overslept.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，来晚了——我睡过头了。

sentences.english: The train was even later than usual.
sentences.chinese: 火车到得甚至比平时还晚。

sentences.english: We apologize for the late departure of flight AZ709.
sentences.chinese: 我们为AZ709航班延误起飞表示歉意。

sentences.english: There are penalties if loan repayments are late.
sentences.chinese: 逾期偿还贷款会被处以罚金。

sentences.english: The stores are open later on Thursdays.
sentences.chinese: 商店星期四开门较晚。

detailed_translations.english: arriving, happening, or done after the time that was expected, agreed, or arranged
after the usual time

sentences.english: The strongest challenger, Texas Democrat Martin Frost, has withdrawn from the race.
sentences.chinese: 最强劲的挑战者，德克萨斯州的民主党人马丁·弗罗斯特已经退出了竞选。

detailed_translations.english: A challenger is someone who competes with you for a position or title that you already have, for example being a sports champion or a political leader

sentences.english: Prosecution and defence lawyers are expected to deliver closing arguments next week.
sentences.chinese: 原告律师和被告律师下周将要作终结辩论。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to advise people about laws, write formal agreements, or represent people in court

sentences.english: Prices are subject to fluctuation.
sentences.chinese: 价格可能会有波动。

detailed_translations.english: a change in a price, amount, level etc

sentences.english: The woman gently tugged his arm.
sentences.chinese: 那女人轻轻拽了拽他的胳膊。

sentences.english: She removed the bandage with a sharp tug.
sentences.chinese: 她猛地一拉，扯下绷带。

detailed_translations.english: to pull with one or more short, quick pulls
a sudden strong pull

sentences.english: Griffiths closely supervised the research.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思密切指导该项研究。

detailed_translations.english: to be in charge of an activity or person, and make sure that things are done in the correct way

sentences.english: The company is closing down two of its factories, leading to 430 job losses .
sentences.chinese: 公司要关闭其中的两家工厂，这将造成430人失业。

sentences.english: Weight loss should be gradual.
sentences.chinese: 减肥应该循序渐进。

sentences.english: a type of hearing loss that affects language development
sentences.chinese: 一种会影响语言能力发展的听力丧失

sentences.english: Brazil's 2–1 loss to Argentina
sentences.chinese: 巴西对阿根廷1:2的落败

detailed_translations.english: the fact of no longer having something, or of having less of it than you used to have, or the process by which this happens

sentences.english: He tried to pass off a false Dagas on the auctioneer.
sentences.chinese: 他试着把假的德加的画卖给拍卖人。

sentences.english: The most talkative is the least intelligent, and there is hardly a difference between an orator and an auctioneer.
sentences.chinese: 话最多的人是最不聪明的人，在一个演说家和一个拍卖人之间，几乎没有分别。

sentences.english: The auctioneer shall state the drawbacks of auction targets to the bidders.
sentences.chinese: 拍卖人应当向竞买人说明拍卖标的的瑕疵。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of selling the things at an auction and who calls out how much money has already been offered for something

sentences.english: a course for students wishing to improve their English
sentences.chinese: 为想提高英语水平的学生开设的一门课

sentences.english: The doctors say she is improving (= after being ill ).
sentences.chinese: 医生说她正在康复。

sentences.english: You could use the money for improving your home.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用这笔钱改善家居。

sentences.english: Many wines improve with age (= get better as they get older ).
sentences.chinese: 很多葡萄酒年代越久越香醇。

detailed_translations.english: to make something better, or to become better
to make something better, or to become better

sentences.english: If the mixture seems dry, add water.
sentences.chinese: 如果混合物看上去干，加点水。

detailed_translations.english: to put something with something else or with a group of other things

sentences.english: ...the introduction of legislation to compel cyclists to wear a helmet.
sentences.chinese: …强制骑车人戴头盔的法律的引入。

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to do something

sentences.english: The slightest movement will defocus the microscope.
sentences.chinese: 最轻微的运动都会使显微镜散焦。

sentences.english: The microscope magnified the object two hundred times.
sentences.chinese: 这架显微镜把实物放大了200倍。

sentences.english: The microscope capacitates small objects to be observed.
sentences.chinese: 显微镜可以观察到微小的物体。

detailed_translations.english: a scientific instrument that makes extremely small things look larger

sentences.english: He could see the disappointment in her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他看到了她眼中的失望。

sentences.english: Several people expressed disappointment at the delay.
sentences.chinese: 有好几个人对这次延误表示失望。

sentences.english: She hid her bitter disappointment .
sentences.chinese: 她把深深的沮丧掩饰起来。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of unhappiness because something is not as good as you expected, or has not happened in the way you hoped

sentences.english: The painting has been authenticated by experts.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画专家鉴定为真迹。

sentences.english: passwords which can authenticate electronic documents
sentences.chinese: 能够验证电子文档的密码

detailed_translations.english: to prove that something is true or real

sentences.english: The neighbours must think we’re crazy.
sentences.chinese: 邻居一定会认为我们疯了。

sentences.english: It’s an absolutely crazy idea .
sentences.chinese: 那绝对是个荒唐的想法。

sentences.english: I know this idea sounds crazy , but it may be worth a try.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这个主意听起来很荒唐，但也许值得一试。

sentences.english: He often works 12 hours a day – it’s crazy .
sentences.chinese: 他常常一天工作12个小时——简直疯了。

detailed_translations.english: very strange or not sensible

name: mineral
trans: 矿物；（英）矿泉水；无机物；苏打水（常用复数表示）

sentences.english: The area is very rich in minerals .
sentences.chinese: 该地区矿产非常丰富。

sentences.english: a country with few mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 矿产资源稀少的国家

sentences.english: mineral water
sentences.chinese: 矿泉水

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is formed naturally in the earth, such as coal, salt, stone, or gold. Minerals can be dug out of the ground and used
of or containing or derived from minerals

sentences.english: All the flats in the building had the same layout.
sentences.chinese: 大楼里所有的公寓布局都是一样的。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which something such as a town, garden, or building is arranged

sentences.english: The 4% pay raise was the result of some hard bargaining .
sentences.chinese: 4%的加薪是经过一番艰苦谈判后才取得的结果。

sentences.english: They prefer to bargain with individual clients, for cash.
sentences.chinese: 他们更愿意同个人客户洽谈，做现金交易。

detailed_translations.english: discussion in order to reach an agreement about a sale, contract etc
When people bargain with each other, they discuss what each of them will do, pay, or receive

name: banking
trans: 银行业；银行业务；银行家的职业；筑堤
把钱存入银行；做银行家；在…边筑堤（bank的现在分词）

sentences.english: the international banking system
sentences.chinese: 国际银行业体制

detailed_translations.chinese: 银行业；银行业务；银行家的职业；筑堤
detailed_translations.english: the business of a bank

detailed_translations.chinese: 把钱存入银行；做银行家；在…边筑堤（bank的现在分词）

name: cooperation
trans: 合作，协作；[劳经] 协力

sentences.english: the need to strengthen international co-operation
sentences.chinese: 加强国际合作的需要

detailed_translations.english: when you work with someone to achieve something that you both want

sentences.english: Which: Identify your obstacles and strategize to overcome them.
sentences.chinese: 确定您的障碍所在，并制定战略来克服这些障碍。

sentences.english: Second, we will strategize on how to apply the emerging understanding so that a rapid scaling up may be possible.
sentences.chinese: 其次，我们将会为关于如何利用这新兴的协议从而使快速的扩大成为可能制定战略。

sentences.english: Sometimes, it's more interesting to play games where you have time to think and strategize or where the goal is to cooperate with each other to win the game.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，玩有时间思考和制定战略或者目标是与他人合作取得胜利的游戏更加吸引人。

sentences.english: a bilingual dictionary
sentences.chinese: 双语词典

sentences.english: The report proposed bilingual education in schools.
sentences.chinese: 报告建议在学校中实行双语教学。

detailed_translations.english: written or spoken in two languages

sentences.english: Their attempts to speak to him were frustrated by the guards.
sentences.chinese: 他们想跟他说话，但被警卫拦住了。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent someone’s plans, efforts, or attempts from succeeding

name: agenda
trans: 议程；日常工作事项；日程表

sentences.english: The Republicans have stuck to their conservative agenda.
sentences.chinese: 共和党人坚持自己的保守议题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 议程；日常工作事项；日程表
detailed_translations.english: a list of problems or subjects that a government, organization etc is planning to deal with

sentences.english: Protection for the consumer is laid down by statute (= established by law ) .
sentences.chinese: 保障消费者权益已有法律明文规定。

detailed_translations.english: a law passed by a parliament, council etc and formally written down

sentences.english: American children did less well in math than their peers in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 美国儿童的数学成绩不如日本的同龄儿童。

sentences.english: Staff members are trained by their peers.
sentences.chinese: 员工由同事培训。

detailed_translations.english: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc

sentences.english: Chinese vases are disposed around the gallery.
sentences.chinese: 中国花瓶摆放在展馆四周。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things or put them in their places

sentences.english: Canada’s vast mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 加拿大丰富的矿产资源

sentences.english: a country rich in natural resources
sentences.chinese: 自然资源丰富的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 资源； 财力； 应付办法， 谋略
detailed_translations.english: something such as useful land, or minerals such as oil or coal, that exists in a country and can be used to increase its wealth

name: agency
trans: 代理，中介；代理处，经销处

sentences.english: a UN agency responsible for helping refugees
sentences.chinese: 负责为难民提供帮助的联合国机构

sentences.english: the Environmental Protection Agency
sentences.chinese: 环保局

detailed_translations.english: an organization or department, especially within a government, that does a specific job

sentences.english: Make a list of all the things you have to do.
sentences.chinese: 把你必须做的所有事情列一个清单。

sentences.english: The first person on my list is Mrs Gilling.
sentences.chinese: 我的名单上排在第一位的是吉林夫人。

sentences.english: The guidebook lists 1,000 hotels and restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 旅游手册上列有1,000家宾馆和餐厅。

detailed_translations.english: a set of names, numbers etc, usually written one below the other, for example so that you can remember or check them
to write a list, or mention things one after the other

name: smash
trans: 了不起的；非常轰动的；出色的

sentences.english: Vandals had smashed all the windows.
sentences.chinese: 破坏分子打碎了所有的窗子。

sentences.english: Firemen had to smash the lock to get in.
sentences.chinese: 消防员不得不砸锁而入。

sentences.english: Several cups fell to the floor and smashed to pieces .
sentences.chinese: 有几个杯子掉到地上摔得粉碎。

detailed_translations.chinese: 粉碎，打烂；狠打，猛击；破灭，失败；猛撞，猛冲
detailed_translations.english: to break into pieces violently or noisily, or to make something do this by dropping, throwing, or hitting it

detailed_translations.chinese: 破碎 ； 猛击， 猛撞； 轰动的演出， 巨大的成功
detailed_translations.english: the loud sound of something breaking

name: section
trans: 截面；部分；部门；地区；章节
被切割成片；被分成部分

sentences.english: The plane’s tail section was found in a cornfield.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的尾部在玉米田里找到了。

sentences.english: the smoking section (= where you can smoke )
sentences.chinese: 吸烟区

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts that something such as an object or place is divided into

name: spend
trans: 度过，消磨（时光）；花费；浪费；用尽

sentences.english: I can’t afford to spend any more money this week.
sentences.chinese: 这星期我没有能力花更多的钱了。

sentences.english: The repairs cost a lot, but it’s money well spent (= a sensible way of spending money ) .
sentences.chinese: 修理费很高，但这是该花的钱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 度过，消磨（时光）；花费；浪费；用尽
detailed_translations.english: to use your money to pay for goods or services

sentences.english: There are many different cell types in the human body .
sentences.chinese: 人体中有许多种不同的细胞类型。

sentences.english: the power of the human mind
sentences.chinese: 人脑的威力

sentences.english: The desire for joy lies deep within the human spirit .
sentences.chinese: 对快乐的渴求藏在人类心灵深处。

sentences.english: Infra-red light is invisible to the human eye.
sentences.chinese: 红外线是人眼看不见的。

sentences.english: theories of human behaviour
sentences.chinese: 关于人类行为的理论

sentences.english: different areas of human experience
sentences.chinese: 人类各方面的经验

sentences.english: respect for the absolute value of human life
sentences.chinese: 对人类生命绝对价值的尊重

sentences.english: The accident was the result of human error.
sentences.chinese: 事故是由于人为过失造成的。

sentences.english: The meat was declared unfit for human consumption.
sentences.chinese: 这种肉被宣布不适合人类食用。

sentences.english: Like humans, cats and dogs are omnivores.
sentences.chinese: 和人类一样，猫和狗是杂食性动物。

detailed_translations.english: belonging to or relating to people, especially as opposed to machines or animals
a person

name: lose
trans: 浪费；使沉溺于；使迷路；遗失；错过

sentences.english: I’ve lost my appetite.
sentences.chinese: 我已经没有了胃口。

sentences.english: Try not to lose heart (= become sad and hopeless ) - there are plenty of other jobs.
sentences.chinese: 不要灰心―还有很多其他的工作。

sentences.english: By the time the ambulance arrived, Douglas had lost consciousness .
sentences.chinese: 救护车赶到时，道格拉斯已经失去知觉。

sentences.english: I followed her on foot, but lost her in the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 我走在她后面，可是在人群中跟丢了。

sentences.english: Klinger lost his seat in the election.
sentences.chinese: 克林格在选举中失去了他的席位。

detailed_translations.english: to stop having a particular attitude, quality, ability etc, or to gradually have less of it

name: hurt
trans: 使受伤；损害；使疼痛；使痛心

sentences.english: Was anyone hurt in the accident?
sentences.chinese: 事故中有人受伤吗？

sentences.english: Put that thing down - you might hurt someone with it.
sentences.chinese: 快把那东西放下，你会伤着别人的。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to hurt your feelings.
sentences.chinese: 我不是故意要伤害你的感情。

detailed_translations.english: to injure yourself or someone else

sentences.english: There are fewer opportunities for new graduates this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年新毕业的大学生就业机会较少。

detailed_translations.english: a chance to do something or an occasion when it is easy for you to do something

sentences.english: The fire was caused by an electrical fault.
sentences.chinese: 大火是电力故障引起的。

sentences.english: an electrical engineer
sentences.chinese: 电力[电气]工程师

detailed_translations.english: relating to electricity

name: absorb
trans: 吸收；吸引；承受；理解；使…全神贯注

sentences.english: Plants absorb nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸收养分。

sentences.english: The movement and noise of the machines absorbed him completely.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转和声响把他完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

sentences.english: Two managers were charged with embezzling $400,000.
sentences.chinese: 两名经理被控挪用了40万美元。

detailed_translations.english: to steal money from the place where you work

name: blue
trans: 蓝色；[复数]（美国海、陆、空三军穿的）蓝色制服；蓝颜料；[the blue(s)][用作单数或复数]布鲁斯（歌曲）（一种伤感的美国黑人民歌
蓝色的；沮丧的，忧郁的；下流的
把…染成蓝色；使成蓝色；给…用上蓝剂；用上蓝剂于

sentences.english: the blue waters of the lake
sentences.chinese: 蓝蓝的湖水

sentences.english: She nearly always dresses in blue.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎总是穿蓝色的衣服。

detailed_translations.english: having the colour of the sky or the sea on a fine day
the colour of the sky or the sea on a fine day

sentences.english: Send the letter by airmail.
sentences.chinese: 这封信用航空邮寄。

detailed_translations.english: letters and packages that are sent somewhere using a plane, or the system of doing this

sentences.english: The synergic extraction is main to from multicomponent complex of mixed ligand in extractive separation.
sentences.chinese: 溶剂萃取分离中的协同萃取，是形成混配多元络合物的主要表现。

sentences.english: A high efficient mixed paraffin remover was prepared with benzene, mutual solvent A, mutual solvent B, and a synergic agent as materials.
sentences.chinese: 针对我国油井结蜡严重的现象，以苯、互溶剂A、互溶剂B和协同剂为原料，制备了一种高效混合清蜡剂。

sentences.english: The absolute effect, relative effect as well as the elastic modulus and synergic relationship to judge improvement effect of the established predictive model were defined.
sentences.chinese: 定义了改善方案预测的绝对效果、相对效果以及指标改善效果有效性判别的弹性系数和协同关系。

name: hostile
trans: 敌对的，敌方的；怀敌意的

sentences.english: Southampton fans gave their former coach a hostile reception .
sentences.chinese: 南安普敦队的球迷对球队的前任教练很不友善。

sentences.english: Carr wouldn’t meet Feng’s stare, which was openly hostile .
sentences.chinese: 卡尔不愿意面对冯公然敌视的目光。

sentences.english: his hostile attitude
sentences.chinese: 他敌对的态度

detailed_translations.english: angry and deliberately unfriendly towards someone, and ready to argue with them

sentences.english: Tighten the screws firmly.
sentences.chinese: 把螺丝拧紧。

sentences.english: I’d put the new tyre on, but I hadn’t tightened up the wheel.
sentences.chinese: 我把新轮胎装上了，但没有上紧轮子。

detailed_translations.english: to close or fasten something firmly by turning it

sentences.english: The booklet provides all the necessary information about the college.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子提供了关于那所学院的所有必需信息。

sentences.english: No further changes were considered necessary.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要作出进一步改变。

sentences.english: The doctor says it may be necessary for me to have an operation.
sentences.chinese: 医生说我可能需要做手术。

sentences.english: The closure of the factory was a necessary consequence of increased competition from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 工厂倒闭是来自国外的竞争加剧的必然结果。

detailed_translations.english: something that is necessary is what you need to have or need to do

sentences.english: the second instalment of a loan
sentences.chinese: 一项贷款的第二期还款

sentences.english: They’re letting me pay for the washing machine by monthly instalments.
sentences.chinese: 他们允许我以每月分期付款的方式买下这台洗衣机。

detailed_translations.english: one of a series of regular payments that you make until you have paid all the money you owe

name: slump
trans: 下降，衰落；倒下；大幅度下降，暴跌

sentences.english: Sales slumped by 20% last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年销售额骤减 20%。

sentences.english: The council's land is now worth much less than originally hoped because of a slump in property prices.
sentences.chinese: 由于地产价格的暴跌，委员会的土地目前大不如原来所希望的那么值钱了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下降，衰落；倒下；大幅度下降，暴跌
detailed_translations.english: to fall or lean against something because you are not strong enough to stand
Slump is also a noun

name: rating
trans: 等级；等级评定；额定功率

sentences.english: By the end of the year the Prime Minister’s approval rating (= how many people agreed with his policies ) had fallen as low as 12 percent.
sentences.chinese: 到年底时，首相的支持率跌到了12%的低点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 等级；等级评定；额定功率
detailed_translations.english: a level on a scale that shows how good, important, popular etc someone or something is

sentences.english: I’ve booked the flights and the hotel.
sentences.chinese: 我已订好机票和酒店。

sentences.english: We’ll be staying at the Hotel Ibis.
sentences.chinese: 我们将住在宜必思酒店。

detailed_translations.english: a building where people pay to stay and eat meals

name: local
trans: [计] 局部；当地居民；本地新闻
当地的；局部的；地方性的；乡土的

sentences.english: local hospital
sentences.chinese: 当地医院

sentences.english: local residents
sentences.chinese: 本地居民

sentences.english: a local infection
sentences.chinese: 局部感染

detailed_translations.english: relating to the particular area you live in, or the area you are talking about

name: act
trans: 行为，行动；法令，法案；（戏剧，歌剧的）一幕，段；装腔作势

sentences.english: The company acted correctly in sacking him.
sentences.chinese: 公司解雇他做得对。

sentences.english: The jury decided that Walker had acted in self-defence.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团裁定沃克的行为属于自卫。

sentences.english: Politicians will only act when enough people demand that they do something.
sentences.chinese: 只有足够多的民众起来要求，政客们才会采取行动。

sentences.english: The padding acts as a cushion if the player falls or is hit by the ball.
sentences.chinese: 万一球员摔倒或者被球击中，衬垫可以起到缓冲作用。

sentences.english: The new president’s first act should be to end the war.
sentences.chinese: 新总统的第一步行动应当是结束战争。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in a particular way or for a particular reason
one thing that you do

sentences.english: He acquired kudos just by appearing on television.
sentences.chinese: 他上电视后就出名了。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being admired and respected for being important or for doing something important

name: influx
trans: 流入；汇集；河流的汇集处

sentences.english: ...problems caused by the influx of refugees.
sentences.chinese: …难民大量涌入所造成的问题。

detailed_translations.english: the arrival of large numbers of people or large amounts of money, goods etc, especially suddenly

name: withdrawal
trans: 撤退，收回；提款；取消；退股

sentences.english: large-scale troop withdrawals
sentences.chinese: 大规模撤军

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤退，收回；提款；取消；退股
detailed_translations.english: the act of moving an army, weapons etc away from the area where they were fighting

sentences.english: nimble fingers
sentences.chinese: 灵巧的手指

sentences.english: a nimble climber
sentences.chinese: 敏捷的攀登者

detailed_translations.english: able to move quickly and easily with light neat movements

name: commuter
trans: 通勤者，经常乘公共车辆往返者；[交] 月季票乘客

detailed_translations.chinese: 通勤者，经常乘公共车辆往返者；[交] 月季票乘客
detailed_translations.english: someone who travels a long distance to work every day

name: viable
trans: 可行的；能养活的；能生育的

sentences.english: viable seeds
sentences.chinese: 可存活的种子

detailed_translations.chinese: 可行的；能养活的；能生育的
detailed_translations.english: a viable idea, plan, or method can work successfully

name: refresher
trans: 可提神的人或物；补习课程；清凉饮料；增加报酬

sentences.english: In addition, picking up some excellent people to take a refresher course is also a good measure.
sentences.chinese: 此外，挑选一些优秀人才去进修也是一个很好的方法。

sentences.english: Her husband always had a huge appetite.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫向来胃口极大。

sentences.english: Symptoms include tiredness and loss of appetite.
sentences.chinese: 症状包括疲倦和食欲不振。

detailed_translations.english: a desire for food

sentences.english: A trade delegation will visit Kuwait.
sentences.chinese: 一个贸易代表团将访问科威特。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who represent a company, organization etc

name: financing
trans: 筹措资金；财政管理；从事金融活动（finance的ing形式）

sentences.english: A United States delegation is in Japan seeking finance for a major scientific project.
sentences.chinese: 1个美国代表团正在日本为一个重大科研项目寻求资助。

sentences.english: The fund has been used largely to finance the construction of federal prisons.
sentences.chinese: 该基金大部分已用于资助联邦监狱的建造。

detailed_translations.english: Finance is also a noun

detailed_translations.chinese: 筹措资金；财政管理；从事金融活动（finance的ing形式）
detailed_translations.english: When someone finances something such as a project or a purchase, they provide the money that is needed to pay for them

name: assistant
trans: 辅助的，助理的；有帮助的

sentences.english: a clerical assistant
sentences.chinese: 文书助理

sentences.english: ...the assistant secretary of defence.
sentences.chinese: …助理国防部长。

detailed_translations.english: someone who helps someone else in their work, especially by doing the less important jobs

detailed_translations.chinese: 辅助的，助理的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: Assistant is used in front of titles or jobs to indicate a slightly lower rank. For example, an assistant director is one rank lower than a director in an organization.

sentences.english: We grew up in the countryside, surrounded by the beauties of nature.
sentences.chinese: 我们在乡村长大，周围是美丽的大自然。

sentences.english: nature conservation
sentences.chinese: 自然保护

sentences.english: Disease is nature’s way of keeping the population down.
sentences.chinese: 疾病是大自然控制人口的方法。

sentences.english: I tried appealing to his better nature (= his feelings of kindness ) but he wouldn’t agree to help us.
sentences.chinese: 我想唤起他的善良本性，但他就是不同意帮助我们。

sentences.english: Capitalist society is by its very nature unstable.
sentences.chinese: 从本质而言，资本主义社会是不稳定的。

detailed_translations.english: everything in the physical world that is not controlled by humans, such as wild plants and animals, earth and rocks, and the weather

sentences.english: He umpired baseball games.
sentences.chinese: 他过去担任棒球比赛的裁判。

detailed_translations.english: to be the umpire in a game or competition
the person who makes sure that the players obey the rules in sports such as tennis, baseball, and cricket

name: subsidize
trans: 资助；给与奖助金；向…行贿

sentences.english: Farming is heavily subsidized (= subsidized a lot ) by the government.
sentences.chinese: 农业得到政府的大量补贴。

detailed_translations.chinese: 资助；给与奖助金；向…行贿
detailed_translations.english: if a government or organization subsidizes a company, activity etc, it pays part of its costs

sentences.english: But if you lose your audience with technical explanations, you'll never get to what you want: a resolution so you can finalize your design.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果您用技术性的解释使受众迷惑，则您永远得不到希望达到的目的：完成设计的解决办法。

sentences.english: Christmas has become so commercialized.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节现已变得非常商业化了。

detailed_translations.english: to be more concerned with making money from something than about its quality - used to show disapproval

name: patronizing
trans: 要人领情的；自视高人一等的；以恩人态度自居的
光顾，惠顾；庇护，保护（patronize的现在分词）

sentences.english: a patronizing attitude
sentences.chinese: 自命不凡的态度

sentences.english: a patronizing tone
sentences.chinese: 高人一等的语气

sentences.english: I don’t mean to sound patronizing.
sentences.chinese: 我没有自命不凡之意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 要人领情的；自视高人一等的；以恩人态度自居的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is patronizing talks to you in a way that shows they think you are less intelligent or important than them

detailed_translations.chinese: 光顾，惠顾；庇护，保护（patronize的现在分词）

name: option
trans: [计] 选项；选择权；买卖的特权

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

name: slack
trans: 松弛的；疏忽的；不流畅的

sentences.english: He was accused of slacking and taking too many holidays.
sentences.chinese: 他被指责工作不努力，休假太多。

detailed_translations.english: to make less effort than usual, or to be lazy in your work

detailed_translations.chinese: 懈怠的，马虎的；萧条的，清淡的，不活跃的；松的
detailed_translations.english: hanging loosely, or not pulled tight
part of a rope that is not stretched tight

name: volatile
trans: [化学] 挥发性的；不稳定的；爆炸性的；反复无常的

sentences.english: an increasingly volatile political situation
sentences.chinese: 日益动荡的政治局势

sentences.english: the highly volatile stock and bond markets
sentences.chinese: 相当不稳定的股票和债券市场

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 挥发性的；不稳定的；爆炸性的；反复无常的
detailed_translations.english: a volatile situation is likely to change suddenly and without warning

sentences.english: Inevitably, fights break out between the members of contending groups.
sentences.chinese: 争权夺利的几个团体之间不可避免地发生了打斗。

detailed_translations.english: to compete against someone in order to gain something
to argue or state that something is true

name: going
trans: 行为；离去；工作情况；地面状况
流行的；进行中的；现存的

sentences.english: His going will be no great loss to the company.
sentences.chinese: 他的离去对公司来说并不算多大的损失。

sentences.english: That's about half the going price on world oil markets.
sentences.chinese: 那大约是世界石油市场上现行价位的一半。

detailed_translations.chinese: 行为；离去；工作情况；地面状况
detailed_translations.english: the act of leaving a place

detailed_translations.chinese: 流行的；进行中的；现存的
detailed_translations.english: The going rate or the going salary is the usual amount of money that you expect to pay or receive for something

name: rubber
trans: 橡胶；橡皮；合成橡胶；按摩师

sentences.english: a rubber ball
sentences.chinese: 橡皮球

detailed_translations.chinese: 橡胶；橡皮；合成橡胶；按摩师
detailed_translations.english: a substance used to make tyres, boots etc, which is made from the juice of a tropical tree or artificially

sentences.english: The current trend is towards more part-time employment.
sentences.chinese: 当前的趋势是雇用更多的兼职人员。

sentences.english: the general trend towards the centralization of political power
sentences.chinese: 政治权力集中化的普遍趋势

sentences.english: A disturbing trend is that victims of violence are getting younger.
sentences.chinese: 一个令人担心的趋势是，暴力行为的受害者越来越年轻。

sentences.english: The growing trend is for single mothers to bring up children by themselves.
sentences.chinese: 单身母亲独自抚养孩子的趋势在上升。

sentences.english: Even so, the underlying trend is positive.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，基本趋势仍是乐观的。

sentences.english: national and international economic trends
sentences.chinese: 国内和国际的经济趋势

sentences.english: the downward trend in the price of gold
sentences.chinese: 黄金价格的下滑势头

sentences.english: Successive presidents have tried to reverse this trend , but without success.
sentences.chinese: 连续几任总统都试图扭转这一趋势，但均未成功。

detailed_translations.english: a general tendency in the way a situation is changing or developing

name: international
trans: 国际组织；国际体育比赛；外国居留者；国际股票
国际的；两国（或以上）国家的；超越国界的；国际关系的；世界的

sentences.english: the response of the international community
sentences.chinese: 国际社会的反响

sentences.english: the UN and other international organizations
sentences.chinese: 联合国和其他国际组织

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving more than one nation

sentences.english: Nothing like that has happened in Europe — yet. But it’s certainly within the realm of possibility, especially as the pain of austerity and internal devaluation drags on.
sentences.chinese: 在欧洲还没有发生这样的事情，但肯定在可能性范畴之内，尤其是随着财政紧缩与内部贬值痛苦的持续，这种可能会增大。

sentences.english: The risk of devaluation (of the currency) does not affect them as much as it does other investors.
sentences.chinese: （货币）贬值风险对他们的影响不像对其他投资商那么大。

sentences.english: We obtained a loan from the government.
sentences.chinese: 我们得了一笔政府贷款。

sentences.english: If you ask him for a loan, he'll come through.
sentences.chinese: 如果你向他贷款，他会满足你的要求的。

sentences.english: The company won't keep going unless we can get some loan.
sentences.chinese: 除非我们能搞到贷款，否则公司就维持不下去了。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you borrow from a bank etc

sentences.english: Have steps been taken to acquaint breeders with their right to apply for licenses?
sentences.chinese: 已经采取措施让饲养动物者了解他们申请执照的权利了吗？

detailed_translations.english: If you acquaint someone with something, you tell them about it so that they know it. If you acquaint yourself with something, you learn about it.

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

sentences.english: The content of the media course includes scripting, editing and camera work.
sentences.chinese: 大众传媒课程的内容包括稿件写作、剪辑和摄像操作。

detailed_translations.english: the ideas, facts, or opinions that are contained in a speech, piece of writing, film, programme etc

sentences.english: Lena moved with the grace of a dancer.
sentences.chinese: 莉娜走路姿势有着舞者般的优美。

sentences.english: He conducted himself with grace and dignity throughout the trial.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审讯过程中他表现得文雅而有尊严。

detailed_translations.english: a smooth way of moving that looks natural, relaxed, and attractive

name: pure
trans: 纯的；纯粹的；纯洁的；清白的；纯理论的

sentences.english: rings made of pure gold
sentences.chinese: 纯金制成的戒指

sentences.english: Our beef patties are 100% pure.
sentences.chinese: 我们的牛肉饼是100%的纯牛肉。

sentences.english: His motives were pure.
sentences.chinese: 他动机纯正。

detailed_translations.english: not mixed with anything else; with nothing added

name: loaf
trans: 游荡；游手好闲；虚度光阴

sentences.english: a loaf of bread
sentences.chinese: 一条面包

detailed_translations.english: bread that is shaped and baked in one piece and can be cut into slices

detailed_translations.chinese: 游荡；游手好闲；虚度光阴
detailed_translations.english: to spend time somewhere and not do very much

sentences.english: The army played a leading role in organizing the attempted coup.
sentences.chinese: 军队在策划这场未遂政变的过程中起了最主要的作用。

sentences.english: the leading industrial nations
sentences.chinese: 主要的工业国

sentences.english: a leading heart specialist
sentences.chinese: 最好的心脏病专家

sentences.english: leading members of the government
sentences.chinese: 政府要员

detailed_translations.english: best, most important, or most successful

name: simply
trans: 简单地；仅仅；简直；朴素地；坦白地

sentences.english: Try to express yourself more simply.
sentences.chinese: 尽量把你的意思表达得更简单明了。

sentences.english: To put it simply, the tax cuts mean the average person will be about 3% better off.
sentences.chinese: 简单地说，这次减税意味着普通人的收入将增加 3% 左右。

sentences.english: We had to live very simply on my father’s small salary.
sentences.chinese: 我们只能靠父亲微薄的工资过着非常简朴的生活。

detailed_translations.english: if you say or explain something simply, you say it in a way that is easy for people to understand

sentences.english: The striped T-shirt became the comedian’s trademark.
sentences.chinese: 条纹T恤衫成了这位喜剧演员的标记。

detailed_translations.chinese: 商标， 牌号； 特征， 标记
detailed_translations.english: a special name, sign, or word that is marked on a product to show that it is made by a particular company, that cannot be used by any other company

sentences.english: officials charged with bribery and corruption
sentences.chinese: 被指控受贿和贪污的官员

sentences.english: The investigation uncovered widespread corruption within the police force.
sentences.chinese: 这项调查揭发出了警察机关内部普遍的腐败。

detailed_translations.english: dishonest, illegal, or immoral behaviour, especially from someone with power

sentences.english: the threat of industrial conflict in the coalfields
sentences.chinese: 煤田发生劳资纠纷的风险

sentences.english: Marx points out the potential conflicts below the surface of society.
sentences.chinese: 马克思指出了隐藏在社会表层之下的潜在矛盾。

sentences.english: His views on the literal truth of the Bible brought him into conflict with other Christian leaders.
sentences.chinese: 他坚持《圣经》字面真理的观点使他与其他的基督教领袖发生了冲突。

sentences.english: Doctors exercise considerable power and often come into conflict with politicians.
sentences.chinese: 医生行使很大的权力，常常和政客们发生冲突。

sentences.english: a lawyer specializing in conflict resolution
sentences.chinese: 专门解决纠纷的律师

detailed_translations.english: a state of disagreement or argument between people, groups, countries etc

name: assurance
trans: 保证，担保；（人寿）保险；确信；断言；厚脸皮，无耻

sentences.english: Despite my repeated assurances, Rob still looked very nervous.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我再三保证，罗布看起来还是很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: a promise that something will definitely happen or is definitely true, made especially to make someone less worried

name: conversion
trans: 转换；变换；[金融] 兑换；改变信仰

sentences.english: ...the conversion of disused rail lines into cycle routes.
sentences.chinese: …把废弃的铁路改变成自行车道。

detailed_translations.english: when you change something from one form, purpose, or system to a different one

sentences.english: The scandal did his career a lot of harm.
sentences.chinese: 丑闻对他的职业生涯造成很大损害。

sentences.english: Our children deserve protection from harm.
sentences.chinese: 我们的儿童理应得到保护免受伤害。

sentences.english: chemicals that harm the environment
sentences.chinese: 损害环境的化学品

detailed_translations.english: damage, injury, or trouble caused by someone’s actions or by an event
to have a bad effect on something

name: sentence
trans: [语][计] 句子，命题；宣判，判决

sentences.english: She received an eight-year prison sentence.
sentences.chinese: 她被判八年徒刑。

sentences.english: He has just begun a life sentence for murder.
sentences.chinese: 他犯了谋杀罪，刚开始服无期徒刑。

sentences.english: Sanchez was sentenced to three years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 桑切斯被判了三年监禁。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment that a judge gives to someone who is guilty of a crime
if a judge sentences someone who is guilty of a crime, they give them a punishment

sentences.english: My parents divorced when I was six, and I hardly knew my father.
sentences.chinese: 我六岁时父母离婚，我对父亲几乎一无所知。

sentences.english: The children were so excited they could hardly speak.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们兴奋得几乎连话都说不出来了。

sentences.english: I can hardly believe it.
sentences.chinese: 这简直让我难以置信。

sentences.english: (= almost no one ) writes to me these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今几乎没有人给我写信了。

sentences.english: Dad ate hardly anything (= almost nothing ).
sentences.chinese: 爸爸几乎没吃什么东西。

sentences.english: There was hardly any (= very little ) traffic.
sentences.chinese: 路上车少人稀。

sentences.english: She lives in Spain, so we hardly ever (= almost never ) see her.
sentences.chinese: 她住在西班牙，所以我们几乎见不到她。

detailed_translations.english: almost not

name: date
trans: 过时；注明日期；始于（某一历史时期）

sentences.english: The date on the letter was 30th August 1962.
sentences.chinese: 信上的日期是1962年8月30日。

sentences.english: What’s today’s date?
sentences.chinese: 今天几号？

sentences.english: Make sure you sign and date it at the bottom.
sentences.chinese: 一定要在底下签上姓名和日期。

detailed_translations.english: a particular day of the month or year, especially shown by a number
to write or print the date on something

sentences.english: The water sports centre will provide you with snorkelling gear and a floatation vest if you would like one.
sentences.chinese: 在水上运动中心将为你提供的浮浅齿轮和浮选背心，如果你想的话。

name: spring
trans: 春天；弹簧；泉水；活力；跳跃

sentences.english: He sprang to his feet (= stood up suddenly ) and rushed after her.
sentences.chinese: 他腾地站起身，冲过去追她。

sentences.english: There are several hot springs in the area.
sentences.chinese: 这地区有几处温泉。

sentences.english: With a spring, the cat leapt on to the table.
sentences.chinese: 猫一跃跳上桌子。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly and quickly in a particular direction, especially by jumping
a place where water comes up naturally from the ground

name: running
trans: 连续的；流动的；跑着的；运转着的

sentences.english: We chose to do cross-country running.
sentences.chinese: 我们选择进行越野赛跑。

detailed_translations.english: Running is the activity of moving fast on foot, especially as a sport

detailed_translations.chinese: 连续的；流动的；跑着的；运转着的
detailed_translations.english: a machine that is in running order is working correctly

sentences.english: It really irritates me when he doesn’t help around the house.
sentences.chinese: 家里的事情他一点都不帮忙，真让我恼火。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel annoyed or impatient, especially by doing something many times or for a long period of time

name: continuation
trans: 继续；续集；延长；附加部分；扩建物

sentences.english: It's the coalition forces who are to blame for the continuation of the war.
sentences.chinese: 是联军应对战争的持续负责。

detailed_translations.chinese: 继续；续集；延长；附加部分；扩建物
detailed_translations.english: something that continues or follows something else that has happened before, without a stop or change

name: personal
trans: 人事消息栏；人称代名词

sentences.english: My personal view is that we shouldn’t offer him the job.
sentences.chinese: 我个人认为我们不该给他这份工作。

sentences.english: Style and colour are a matter of personal taste .
sentences.chinese: 款式和颜色是个人爱好问题。

sentences.english: She took full personal responsibility for all the arrangements.
sentences.chinese: 她个人对所有的安排承担全部责任。

sentences.english: When I went to her room all her personal belongings had gone.
sentences.chinese: 我到她房间时，她所有的私人物品都已不在了。

sentences.english: After Alan’s death, his mother received his personal effects .
sentences.chinese: 艾伦死后，他母亲接收了他的私人物品。

sentences.english: I know from personal experience that you can’t trust Ralph.
sentences.chinese: 根据我的亲身经验，我认为你不能相信拉尔夫。

sentences.english: the personal qualities needed to be successful in business
sentences.chinese: 生意成功所需要的个人素质

sentences.english: The car is for personal use only.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车仅供私人使用。

sentences.english: On a personal level he felt sympathy for them, but he had a job to do.
sentences.chinese: 从个人角度他很同情他们，但是他有任务在身。

sentences.english: celebrities with their own personal trainer
sentences.chinese: 拥有私人健身教练的名流

detailed_translations.english: belonging or relating to one particular person, rather than to other people or to people in general

name: equation
trans: 方程式，等式；相等；[化学] 反应式

sentences.english: When children enter the equation , further tensions may arise within a marriage.
sentences.chinese: 有了孩子以后，婚姻中可能出现新的矛盾。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or situation in which several things must be considered and dealt with

name: irrevocable
trans: 不可改变的；不能取消的；不能挽回的

sentences.english: Think about the situation carefully before you take an irrevocable step.
sentences.chinese: 在你踏出不能回头的一步之前要三思。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可改变的；不能取消的；不能挽回的
detailed_translations.english: an irrevocable decision, action etc cannot be changed or stopped

name: grade
trans: 年级；等级；成绩；级别；阶段

sentences.english: Pencils are graded according to softness.
sentences.chinese: 铅笔按软硬度分级。

sentences.english: The best grades of tea are expensive.
sentences.chinese: 最上等的茶叶价格很贵。

detailed_translations.english: to say what level of a quality something has, or what standard it is
a particular level of quality that a product, material etc has

sentences.english: I asked Clive where he was going, but he didn’t reply.
sentences.chinese: 我问克莱夫到哪儿去，但他没有回答。

sentences.english: Sorry it took me so long to reply.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我过了这么久才回复。

sentences.english: ‘Did you see Simon today?’ ‘Of course,’ Nathalie replied with a smile.
sentences.chinese: “你今天见到西蒙了吗？”“当然啦。”纳萨莉笑着答道。

sentences.english: I tried calling, but there was no reply.
sentences.chinese: 我试着打电话去，但没有人接。

detailed_translations.english: to answer someone by saying or writing something
something that is said, written, or done as a way of replying

name: downside
trans: 负面，缺点；下降趋势；底侧

sentences.english: Digital cell phones offer more security, but the downside is that they have less power.
sentences.chinese: 数字手机安全性更好，但其劣势在于电力不足。

detailed_translations.chinese: 负面，缺点；下降趋势；底侧

name: slide
trans: 滑动；滑落；不知不觉陷入

sentences.english: He slid open the door of the glass cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 他滑开玻璃柜的门。

detailed_translations.english: to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way
to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way
a large structure with steps leading to the top of a long sloping surface which children can slide down

sentences.english: Sergeant Horne sprinted to the car.
sentences.chinese: 霍恩中士冲向那辆汽车。

detailed_translations.english: to run very fast for a short distance
a short race in which the runners, riders, swimmers etc move very fast over a short distance

sentences.english: They lose their entitlement to welfare when they start work.
sentences.chinese: 他们开始工作时就丧失了享受福利的权利。

detailed_translations.english: the official right to have or do something, or the amount that you have a right to receive

sentences.english: the ability to walk
sentences.chinese: 行走的能力

sentences.english: The test measures your mathematical ability.
sentences.chinese: 这种测试考查的是数学能力。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being able to do something

sentences.english: The edge of this axe has turned.
sentences.chinese: 这把斧子卷了刃了。

sentences.english: He had just hit her over the head with the blunt end of an axe, fracturing her skull in three places.
sentences.chinese: 就在刚刚，他用斧子另一端猛敲了妮基的头一下，将她的颅骨敲断裂成了三块。

sentences.english: If all else fails, take all the unused hardware out to the back yard and go to town with a handy bat, golf club, machete, or axe.
sentences.chinese: 如果一切都失败了，采取一切无用的硬件出到后院，去同一个方便的球棒，高尔夫球俱乐部，砍刀，斧头或到城里。

detailed_translations.english: a tool with a heavy metal blade on the end of a long handle, used to cut down trees or split pieces of wood

sentences.english: I wish my son would show more initiative.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我的儿子能表现得再主动一些。

sentences.english: Don’t keep asking me for advice. Use your initiative.
sentences.chinese: 别老是要我给你出主意，发挥一下你自己的决断能力吧。

sentences.english: Lt. Carlos was not obeying orders. He acted on his own initiative (= he was not told what to do ).
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯中尉没有服从命令，而是自作主张。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to make decisions and take action without waiting for someone to tell you what to do

sentences.english: Reverse the paper in the printer.
sentences.chinese: 把打印机中的纸翻过来。

sentences.english: The wrong attitude will have exactly the reverse effect.
sentences.chinese: 这种错误的态度会得到恰好相反的结果。

detailed_translations.english: if a vehicle or its driver reverses, they go backwards

detailed_translations.chinese: 反向的； 相反的； 颠倒的
detailed_translations.english: Reverse means opposite from what you expect or to what has just been described

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤销，废除；使完全相反，彻底转变；使反转，使次序颠倒
detailed_translations.english: to change something, such as a decision, judgment, or process so that it is the opposite of what it was before

detailed_translations.chinese: 相反情况，对立面；反面，背面，后面；损失，倒退
detailed_translations.english: the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

sentences.english: The new trade agreement should facilitate more rapid economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 新贸易协定应当会加快经济发展。

sentences.english: Structured teaching facilitates learning.
sentences.chinese: 有条理的教导有利于学习。

detailed_translations.english: to make an action or a process possible or easier

name: arbitrageur
trans: 从事于套利或套汇之人

detailed_translations.chinese: 套汇商人； 套汇掮客
detailed_translations.english: In finance, an arbitrager is someone who buys currencies, securities, or commodities on one country's market in order to make money by immediately selling them at a profit on another country's market

sentences.english: The desire for peace transcended political differences.
sentences.chinese: 对和平的渴望超越了政治分歧。

detailed_translations.english: to go beyond the usual limits of something

sentences.english: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她有个出自前一次婚姻的十几岁的女儿。

detailed_translations.english: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about

name: payment
trans: 付款，支付；报酬，报答；偿还；惩罚，报应

sentences.english: She demanded payment in advance.
sentences.chinese: 她要求预先付款。

sentences.english: Payment can be made by cheque or credit card.
sentences.chinese: 可以用支票或信用卡付款。

detailed_translations.english: the act of paying for something

name: inmate
trans: (尤指)同院病人；同狱犯人；同被(收容所)收容者

sentences.english: ...education for prison inmates.
sentences.chinese: …对囚犯们的教育。

detailed_translations.chinese: (尤指)同院病人；同狱犯人；同被(收容所)收容者
detailed_translations.english: someone who is being kept in a prison

name: settlement
trans: 解决，处理；[会计] 结算；沉降；殖民

sentences.english: Union leaders and company bosses will meet tomorrow in an attempt to reach a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 工会领导人和公司老板将于明天举行会议以期达成协议。

sentences.english: His lawyers are understood to be negotiating a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 据说他的律师正在商谈一个协议。

sentences.english: Hopes grew that a workable peace settlement might emerge.
sentences.chinese: 达成一项可行的和平协定的希望越来越大。

sentences.english: She got her home as part of the divorce settlement .
sentences.chinese: 根据离婚协议，她拿到了房子。

sentences.english: The company paid out over $10 million in an out-of-court settlement .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司花了1,000多万美元进行庭外和解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解决； 协议； 居留地， 小社区
detailed_translations.english: an official agreement or decision that ends an argument, a court case, or a fight, or the action of making an agreement

name: noncommittal
trans: 态度不明朗的；不承担义务的；无明确意义的

sentences.english: Mr. Hall is non-committal about the number of jobs that the development corporation has created.
sentences.chinese: 霍尔先生对开发公司已创造的岗位数量含糊其词。

sentences.english: Sylvia's face was noncommittal.
sentences.chinese: 西尔维娅的脸显得不置可否。

sentences.english: ...a very bland noncommittal answer.
sentences.chinese: ...一个不疼不痒、不明不白的答复。

detailed_translations.chinese: 态度不明朗的；不承担义务的；无明确意义的
detailed_translations.english: You can describe someone as noncommittal when they deliberately do not express their opinion or intentions clearly

sentences.english: Pare the brown skin from the meat with a very sharp knife.
sentences.chinese: 用一把非常锋利的刀削掉肉上褐色的皮。

sentences.english: He took out a slab of cheese, pared off a slice and ate it hastily.
sentences.chinese: 他拿出厚厚的一块奶酪，切下一片急匆匆地吃了。

detailed_translations.english: When you pare something, or pare part of it off or away, you cut off its skin or its outer layer

sentences.english: The judges have made their final selection.
sentences.chinese: 评委已经作出最后的评选。

sentences.english: These drawings represent a selection from a larger exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 这些画作是从一个规模更大的展会上选出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the careful choice of a particular person or thing from a group of similar people or things

name: reasonable
trans: 合理的，公道的；通情达理的

sentences.english: a reasonable request
sentences.chinese: 合情合理的要求

sentences.english: Be reasonable — you can’t expect her to do all the work on her own!
sentences.chinese: 要讲道理，你不能指望她一个人干所有的工作！

sentences.english: I thought it was a perfectly reasonable (= completely reasonable ) question.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这个问题问得很有道理。

sentences.english: He had reasonable grounds (= good reasons but no proof ) for believing the law had been broken.
sentences.chinese: 他有合理的根据认为有人违法了。

sentences.english: good food at a reasonable price
sentences.chinese: 价格公道的美食

detailed_translations.english: fair and sensible

name: employ
trans: 使用，采用；雇用；使忙于，使从事于

sentences.english: The factory employs over 2,000 people.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂雇用了2,000多名员工。

sentences.english: The report examines teaching methods employed in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 这个报告探讨了课堂教学方法。

sentences.english: Her days are employed in gardening and voluntary work.
sentences.chinese: 她的时间都花在搞园艺和做义工上。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone to work for you

sentences.english: I have quite a good relationship with my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母关系很好。

sentences.english: the relationship between diet and health problems
sentences.chinese: 膳食与健康问题之间的联系

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people or two groups feel about each other and behave towards each other

name: field
trans: 领域；牧场；旷野；战场；运动场

sentences.english: a view of green fields and rolling hills
sentences.chinese: 田野青翠、丘陵起伏的景色

sentences.english: Fans cheered as the players took the field (= went onto the field ) .
sentences.chinese: 球员上场时球迷们欢呼起来。

detailed_translations.english: an area of land in the country, especially one where crops are grown or animals feed on grass

name: replace
trans: 取代，代替；替换，更换；归还，偿还；把…放回原处

sentences.english: I’m replacing Sue on the team.
sentences.chinese: 我将接替队里的休。

sentences.english: Lectures have replaced the old tutorial system.
sentences.chinese: 课堂授课取代了旧式的导师制。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something instead of another person, or start being used instead of another thing

name: institute
trans: 开始（调查）；制定；创立；提起（诉讼）

sentences.english: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将制定许多措施更好地保护公众。

sentences.english: research institutes
sentences.chinese: 研究所

detailed_translations.english: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
detailed_translations.english: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

name: careless
trans: 粗心的；无忧无虑的；淡漠的

sentences.english: It was careless of him to leave the door unlocked.
sentences.chinese: 他忘了锁门，真是粗心大意。

sentences.english: a careless mistake
sentences.chinese: 粗心造成的错误

sentences.english: careless driving
sentences.chinese: 粗心驾驶

sentences.english: Careless talk can be disastrous for a business.
sentences.chinese: 谈话不慎有时会给企业带来灾难性的损失。

sentences.english: She gave a careless shrug.
sentences.chinese: 她漠然地耸了耸肩。

detailed_translations.english: not paying enough attention to what you are doing, so that you make mistakes, damage things etc

sentences.english: He borrowed £150,000 and used the money for legal expenses.
sentences.chinese: 他借了15万英镑用于支付律师费。

sentences.english: Conference rooms were equipped at great expense.
sentences.chinese: 装备会议室花费巨大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 花费， 消费， 费用； 开支， 业务费用
detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you spend on something

sentences.english: Weather patterns have changed in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 气候模式近年已经发生了变化。

sentences.english: A general pattern began to emerge .
sentences.chinese: 一个总体模式开始显现。

sentences.english: Their descriptions seemed to follow a set pattern (= always develop in the same way ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的描述似乎依据固定的模式。

sentences.english: His behavior fits a pattern of violent acts.
sentences.chinese: 他的举动符合暴力行为的模式。

sentences.english: a dress pattern
sentences.chinese: 连衣裙的纸样

detailed_translations.english: the regular way in which something happens, develops, or is done

name: extractive
trans: 提取的；可萃取的；精萃的

detailed_translations.english: something extracted or capable of being extracted

detailed_translations.chinese: 提取的；可萃取的；精萃的
detailed_translations.english: tending or serving to extract

sentences.english: a car showroom
sentences.chinese: 汽车展厅

detailed_translations.english: a large room where you can look at things that are for sale, such as cars or electrical goods

name: inventory
trans: 存货，存货清单；详细目录；财产清册

sentences.english: ...one inventory of twelve sails for each yacht.
sentences.chinese: …为每艘游艇配备12张帆的存货。

detailed_translations.chinese: 详细目录， 存货清单
detailed_translations.english: a list of all the things in a place

sentences.english: They all had sticks which they planned to use as weapons.
sentences.chinese: 他们都持有棍棒，打算当武器用。

detailed_translations.english: something that you use to fight with or attack someone with, such as a knife, bomb, or gun

name: documentation
trans: 文件, 证明文件, 史实, 文件编制

sentences.english: Applicants must provide supporting documentation .
sentences.chinese: 申请人必须提供证明文件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 文件, 证明文件, 史实, 文件编制
detailed_translations.english: official documents, reports etc that are used to prove that something is true or correct

name: stifle
trans: （马等的）后膝关节；（马等的）[动] 后膝关节病

sentences.english: He was almost stifled by the fumes.
sentences.chinese: 他差点被烟熏得窒息了。

detailed_translations.chinese: （马等的）后膝关节；（马等的）[动] 后膝关节病

name: keen
trans: 敏锐的，敏捷的；渴望的；强烈的；热心的；锐利的

sentences.english: keen students
sentences.chinese: 求知若渴的学生

sentences.english: The kids in my class are all very keen.
sentences.chinese: 我班上的学生都很好学。

sentences.english: She was new in the job and keen as mustard (= very keen ).
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始做这工作，热情很高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

name: windfall
trans: 意外之财；被风吹落的果子；意外的收获

sentences.english: his £2 million windfall in the lottery
sentences.chinese: 他彩票中奖得来的200万英镑意外之财

detailed_translations.chinese: 意外之财；被风吹落的果子；意外的收获
detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you get unexpectedly

name: liberalization
trans: 自由化；自由主义化；放宽限制

sentences.english: "The problem is not trade liberalization, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “问题不在于贸易自由化，”他说。

sentences.english: New steps should be made in trade facilitation and liberalization to boost the integration of the three economies.
sentences.chinese: 在贸易促进和自由化方面迈出新的步伐，推动三国朝着经济一体化方向发展。

sentences.english: In the past decade, liberalization and globalization have been the hallmark of economic policy throughout the world.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的十年里，自由化和全球化是经济政策的显著标志，全世界都是如此。

name: part
trans: 部分；角色；零件；一些；片段

sentences.english: For part of the day, you will be outside doing practical work.
sentences.chinese: 你们每天将有一部分时间在户外实际操作。

sentences.english: Lay all the parts out before you start assembling the model.
sentences.chinese: 开始组装模型之前把所有的零件都摆放出来。

detailed_translations.english: a piece or feature of something such as an object, area, event, or period of time

name: infrastructure
trans: 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造

sentences.english: Some countries lack a suitable economic infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家缺乏适当的经济基础设施。

sentences.english: a $65 billion investment package in education, health care and infrastructure
sentences.chinese: 用于教育、医疗和基础设施的650亿美元一揽子投资计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造
detailed_translations.english: the basic systems and structures that a country or organization needs in order to work properly, for example roads, railways, banks etc

name: confirm
trans: 确认；确定；证实；批准；使巩固
